subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Jupiter is shrinking?
author: Snowfire Lioness
full_text:
----------MB_8CDA1EAC05F77BC_1CF4_9298_webmail-d099.sysops.aol.com
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="utf-8"

 I know, I don't know it's so hard for humans to solve our own problems, ye=
t they seem to know all about other planets, I think greed has a lot to do =
with it though.=C2=A0 Cool clips of Jupiter turning, NASA clips.

http://co=
mmons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Jupiter_from_Voyager_1_PIA02855_lower_quality=
.ogv

Does anyone hear that file i just sent?=C2=A0 I need to have someone =
else hear it, please, and don't lie, if you can't hear, then get with me on=
 Skype, and I will play it for you Steve. sf



 



-----Original Message-=
----
From: Adriana Jones <adrianamjones@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoog=
roups.com
Sent: Wed, Feb 23, 2011 10:12 pm
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Jupiter i=
s shrinking?

          =C2=A0                                  Why is it t=
hat science can figure out that Jupiter.... JUPITER!.... a frazillion miles=
 away is shrinking by 2 dinkymeters a year, but they can't put their heads =
together to solve world hunger, and other more pressing problems.... sorry,=
 snow I don't want to take away from your post, I just had to get that off =
my chest....
 
 --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, SnowfireL@... wrote:
 >
=
 > Interesting things about Jupiter:  "Although Jupiter would need to be=
  
 > about 75 times as massive to fuse hydrogen and become a _star_ 
 &=
gt; (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star) , the smallest _red dwarf_ 
 > (=
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_dwarf)  is only about 30  percent larger i=
n radius than Jupiter._[27]_ 
 > (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jupiter#c=
ite_note-26) _[28]_ 
 > (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jupiter#cite_note-=
27)   Despite this, Jupiter still radiates 
 > more heat than it receive=
s from the Sun.  The amount of heat produced inside 
 > the planet is ne=
arly equal to the total _solar radiation_ 
 > (http://en.wikipedia.org/w=
iki/Solar_radiation)  it  receives._[29]_ 
 > (http://en.wikipedia.org/w=
iki/Jupiter#cite_note-elkins-tanton-28)   This additional heat radiation is=
 
 > generated by the _Kelvin-Helmholtz  mechanism_ 
 > (http://en.wi=
kipedia.org/wiki/Kelvin-Helmholtz_mechanism)  through _adiabatic_ 
 > (h=
ttp://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adiabatic_process)  contraction.  This process =
results in the planet 
 > shrinking by about 2 cm each year._[30]_ 
 &gt=
; (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jupiter#cite_note-guillot04-29)   When it w=
as first formed, Jupiter was much hotter 
 > and was about twice its  cu=
rrent diameter._[31]_ 
 > (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jupiter#cite_not=
e-30) "
 >

<div style=3D"font-family: arial; color: black; font-size: 10pt;"> I know,=
 I don't know it's so hard for humans to solve our own problems, yet they s=
eem to know all about other planets, I think greed has a lot to do with it =
though.  Cool clips of Jupiter turning, NASA clips.<br>
<br>
http://co=
mmons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Jupiter_from_Voyager_1_PIA02855_lower_quality=
.ogv<br>
<br>
Does anyone hear that file i just sent?  I need to have =
someone else hear it, please, and don't lie, if you can't hear, then get wi=
th me on Skype, and I will play it for you Steve. sf<br>
<br>
<br>
</div>

</div>
